isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Flywheel and Flywheel Housing - Recondition - Replace Flywheel Ring Gear

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear heat resistant gloves when handling heated components.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not heat ring gear higher than 278 °C (500 °F). Heating beyond this temperature will adversely affect the ring gear hardness.

step1.para: Evenly heat ring gear with a torch to expand the gear for removal.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not hit the flywheel when knocking the ring gear off the flywheel.

step1.para: After the ring gear is heated, carefully knock the ring gear off the flywheel. Do not hit the flywheel when removing the ring gear.
Heat the new ring gear evenly until gear expands enough to slip onto the flywheel.
Make sure ring gear is properly seated against flywheel shoulder along the entire radius of the flywheel.
